channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What is happening at Newark Airport? This and other questions answered
item.description: Hundreds of flight delays and cancellations at Newark's airport over the past several days are giving passengers headaches and spurring promises to improve the nation's air traffic control system.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of flight delays and cancellations at Newark's airport over the past several days are giving passengers headaches and spurring promises to improve the nation's air traffic control system.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Why oil prices are falling, and what it means for the economy
item.description: Between tariffs roiling the global economy and OPEC putting more barrels on the market, prices have dropped significantly since January. That's good for consumers, and bad for oil companies.
item.content:encoded:
Between tariffs roiling the global economy and OPEC putting more barrels on the market, prices have dropped significantly since January. That's good for consumers, and bad for oil companies.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Hegseth says he's a change agent at DoD. But details are scarce
item.description: The most detailed plan to reshape the Army began taking shape long before Pete Hegseth's arrival as secretary of defense.
item.content:encoded:
The most detailed plan to reshape the Army began taking shape long before Pete Hegseth's arrival as secretary of defense.

(Image credit: Jen Golbeck)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: India launches missile attacks on Pakistan
item.description: India has launched strikes in several parts of Pakistan and Pakistan-controlled territory, in a dramatic escalation of tensions between the two nuclear-armed rivals.
item.content:encoded:
India has launched strikes in several parts of Pakistan and Pakistan-controlled territory, in a dramatic escalation of tensions between the two nuclear-armed rivals.

(Image credit: Punit Paranjpe)
item.dc:creator: NPR's International Desk

item.title: Who are the Cardinals Who Will Pick the Next Pope?
item.description: This week 133 cardinals will meet in the Sistine Chapel at the Vatican to select a new pope who will lead the world's 1.4 billion Catholics. This will be the first papal conclave in which fewer than half the voting cardinals are European. During his time, Pope Frances selected many cardinals from the global south and our correspondent in Rome tells us how this could influence who the next pope will be.
item.content:encoded:
This week 133 cardinals will meet in the Sistine Chapel at the Vatican to select a new pope who will lead the world's 1.4 billion Catholics. This will be the first papal conclave in which fewer than half the voting cardinals are European. During his time, Pope Frances selected many cardinals from the global south and our correspondent in Rome tells us how this could influence who the next pope will be.

(Image credit: Antonio Masiello)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: States win a legal injunction against President Trump, pausing library funding cuts
item.description: A federal judge Tuesday wrote that President Trump's executive order dismantling the IMLS "disregards the fundamental constitutional role of each of the branches of our federal government."
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge Tuesday wrote that President Trump's executive order dismantling the IMLS "disregards the fundamental constitutional role of each of the branches of our federal government."

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Major deepfake porn site shuts down
item.description: MrDeepFakes said that a critical service provider terminated service, resulting in massive data loss. The site, which featured nonconsensual, sexually explicit content, said it would not relaunch.
item.content:encoded:
MrDeepFakes said that a critical service provider terminated service, resulting in massive data loss. The site, which featured nonconsensual, sexually explicit content, said it would not relaunch.

(Image credit: Mr. Deepfakes)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Senate confirms Trump's pick to run Social Security amid upheaval at the agency
item.description: Tech CEO Frank Bisignano will be leading the federal agency that runs programs providing retirement, survivor and disability benefits, as well as supplemental income for the very poor.
item.content:encoded:
Tech CEO Frank Bisignano will be leading the federal agency that runs programs providing retirement, survivor and disability benefits, as well as supplemental income for the very poor.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Supreme Court upholds Trump's ban on transgender military members while appeals continue
item.description: The justices blocked a lower court order that temporarily halted the ban's enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
The justices blocked a lower court order that temporarily halted the ban's enforcement.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Syrian Druze recall what they believe to be past lives â€” even vivid details
item.description: In Syria's large Druze minority, a belief in reincarnation binds the community together.
item.content:encoded:
In Syria's large Druze minority, a belief in reincarnation binds the community together.

(Image credit: Emily Garthwaite for NPR)
